Detect overlaps in high-noise sequences using MHAP. Generate corrected sequence consensus. Trim corrected sequences. Assemble trimmed corrected sequences. Takes all-vs-all read self-mappings (typically by minimap) as input and outputs an assembly graph in the GFA format. Different from mainstream assemblers, miniasm does not have a consensus step. It simply concatenates pieces of read sequences to generate the final contig sequences. Thus, the per-base error rate is similar to the raw input reads.
